name: Throwing Bones
description:
You are recently deceased and must fight your way through the skeleton-ridden districts of purgatory to get access the gate back to life. The only problem...you have no idea who the bosses are and only 24 hours before you are stranded forever. Are you ready to Throw Bones??

All inputs are keyboard based.  Arrow keys to navigate  and enter to make selections. Press spacebar for a reminder on the scoring criteria in game.

Battle Mechanic is based of the dice game Bones, similar to Yahtzee.

You roll 5 dice and they will be scored based off the following criteria:

1s = 100
5s = 50
3x1s = 1000
3x2s = 200
3x3s = 300
3x4s = 400
3x5s = 500
3x6s = 600
4xXs = +500
5xXs = 10000

You can save dice to make the best combo possible re-roll the remaining dice or save the points you have.  But beware, that if your remaining dice fail to score points, all of your points will be lost.

Score 3000 points to win!

*There are some random scoring bugs*

The AI will always roll until they have accumulated 300 points or more.

Game is made in Gameboy style.  Game resolution is 160x144 and uses a 4 color palette to emulate the Gameboy.

Feel free to read more on the rules of bones here:

https://ourpastimes.com/play-dice-game-bones-4523636.html
